title: conferred on it by section 3 (6)(a) of the Wireless Telegraphy Act 1926 (No. 45
heading: 1. This order may be cited as the Wireless Telegraphy Act 1926 (section 3)
text_raw:
1. This order may be cited as the Wireless Telegraphy Act 1926 (section 3) 

(Exemption of Terminals for Satellite Services) Order 2020. 

Interpretation
text_norm: 1 order may cited wireless telegraphy act 1926 (section 3) (exemption terminal satellite services) order 2020 interpretation

text_raw:
3. 

In this order- 

“Document 20/47” means the Document entitled “Permitted Licence 
Exemptions for Terminals for Satellite Services” published on the 19 
June 2020 and any amendment, revision or replacement thereof;

title: conferred on it by section 3 (6)(a) of the Wireless Telegraphy Act 1926 (No. 45
heading: 4. The classes of apparatus for wireless telegraphy described in the
text_raw:
4. The classes of apparatus for wireless telegraphy described in the 
Schedule to this Order are hereby declared to be classes of apparatus for wireless 
telegraphy to which section 3 of the Wireless Telegraphy Act 1926 as amended 
does not apply.
text_norm: 4 class apparatus wireless telegraphy described schedule order hereby declared class apparatus wireless telegraphy section 3 wireless telegraphy act 1926 amended apply

title: conferred on it by section 3 (6)(a) of the Wireless Telegraphy Act 1926 (No. 45
heading: 5. The following statutory instruments are hereby revoked:
text_raw:
5. The following statutory instruments are hereby revoked: 

(1) Statutory Instrument Number 273 of 2000, the Wireless Telegraphy Act 
1926 (Section 3) (Exemption of Certain Fixed Satellite Receiving Earth Stations) 
Order 2000; 

(2) Statutory Instrument Number 398 of 2001, the Wireless Telegraphy Act 
1926 (Section 3) (Exemption of certain classes of Land Mobile Earth Stations) 
Order 2001; 

(3) Statutory Instrument Number 505 of 2003, the Wireless Telegraphy Act 
1926 (Section 3 (Exemption of Certain Classes of Fixed Satellite Earth Stations) 
Order 2003; 

(4) Statutory Instrument Number 7 of 2004, the Wireless Telegraphy Act 
1926 (Section 3) (Exemption of Low Power Aircraft Earth Stations) Order 2004; 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 26th June, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [226] 3 

(5) Statutory Instrument Number 128 of 2005, the Wireless Telegraphy Act 
1926 (Section 3) (Exemption of certain classes of Land Mobile Earth Stations) 
Order 2005; and 

(6) Statutory Instrument Number 343 of 2008, the Wireless Telegraphy Act 
1926 (Section 3) (Exemption of Low Power Earth Stations on board Vessels) 
Order 2008. 

 
 
 
 
 4 [226] 

Apparatus for wireless telegraphy to which section 3 of the Wireless Telegraphy 
Act 1926 does not apply: 

Schedule 

Terminals for satellite services which are of a type described in ComReg 
Document 20/47, as amended, entitled “Permitted Licence Exemptions 
for Terminals for Satellite Services” and which operate in accordance 
with the technical parameters of that Document. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Commission for 
Communications Regulation 

 23 June 2020. 

JEREMY GODFREY 

Commissioner, For and on Behalf of the Commission 
for Communications Regulation. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [226] 5

title: conferred on it by section 3 (6)(a) of the Wireless Telegraphy Act 1926 (No. 45
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order provides for the exemption of certain wireless telegraphy apparatus, 
namely terminals for satellite services, which meet certain conditions stated in 
the face of the order, from the requirement to be licensed under the Wireless 
Telegraphy Act 1926. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [226]
